*   Google Scholar

【117】Dermoscopy may further lower the risk of potential harm by improving the accuracy of diagnosis and reducing the number of excisions of benign lesions.

【118】无关删除-2*   Koelink C.J.
*   Vermeulen K.M.
*   Kollen B.J.
*   et al.

【119】Diagnostic accuracy and cost-effectiveness of dermoscopy in primary care: a cluster randomized clinical trial.

【120】无关删除-2_J Eur Acad Dermatol Venereol._ 2014; 28 : 1442-1449

【121】无关删除-2*   Crossref
*   PubMed
*   Scopus (35)
*   Google Scholar

【122】Although dermoscopy is most commonly used by dermatologists, primary care physicians in this study were able to improve their sensitivity for the diagnosis of melanoma while also reducing the number of excisions of benign lesions.

【123】### Plan of Action

【124】The burden rests on the shoulders of primary care physicians. There is approximately 1 dermatologist for every 30,000 patients in the United States.

【125】Association of American Medical Colleges  
2014 Physician specialty data bank.

【126】https://www.aamc.org/data

【127】无关删除-2*   Google Scholar

【128】A combined effort between primary care and dermatology is necessary to improve screening rates and mortality. Lack of time and lack of training in skin cancer examination (SCE) have been identified as barriers to screening.

【129】无关删除-2*   Oliveria S.A.
*   Heneghan M.K.
*   Cushman L.F.
*   Ughetta E.A.
*   Halpern A.C.

【130】Skin cancer screening by dermatologists, family practitioners, and internists: barriers and facilitating factors.

【131】无关删除-2_Arch Dermatol._ 2011; 147 : 39-44

【132】无关删除-2*   Crossref
*   PubMed
*   Scopus (71)
*   Google Scholar

【133】A 2009 survey study of 4 US residency programs included questionnaires from 94.1% of residents in primary care tracks. During residency, 75.8% were never trained in SCE; 55.3% never observed an SCE; and only 15.9% reported being skilled in SCE.

【134】无关删除-2*   Wise E.
*   Singh D.
*   Moore M.
*   et al.

【135】Rates of skin cancer screening and prevention counseling by US medical residents.

【136】无关删除-2_Arch Dermatol._ 2009; 145 : 1131-1136

【137】无关删除-2*   Crossref
*   PubMed
*   Scopus (28)
*   Google Scholar

【138】We advocate improved education on SCE in primary care residency training programs as a means to improve screening rates. The development of a formal dermatology curriculum, both reproducible and generalizable, may be the foundation for heightened early detection. The American Academy of Dermatology has developed a Basic Dermatology Curriculum composed of 48 learning modules that are freely accessible on their website.

【139】American Academy of Dermatology  
Basic dermatology curriculum.

【140】http://www.aad.org/education/basic-derm-curriculum

【141】无关删除-2*   Google Scholar

【142】More specific to skin cancer is the Internet Curriculum for Melanoma Early Detection (INFORMED).

【143】Visual Dx  
INFORMED Skin Cancer Education Series.

【144】https://visualdx.com/educational-resources/melanoma-education-informed

【145】无关删除-2*   Google Scholar

【146】These are excellent resources that we have integrated into our internal medicine residency curriculum. Although decisive conclusions about screening outcomes are currently unavailable, changes in dermatology education to enhance SCE skills for physicians training in primary care are an important step in the path to successful screening.

【147】### Conclusion

【148】Current and future advances in melanoma treatment may have major potential to improve outcomes; however, we believe that prevention and early detection need further attention to make the largest mortality impact. Ethical implications and design limitations contribute to the lack of high-quality evidence from randomized studies evaluating the efficacy of cancer screening. Until the evidence base for melanoma screening is further expanded, we propose that a heightened focus is necessary for patients with the highest risk of this disease. White men older than 50 years have a higher risk of dying of this disease, and risk in this group continues to increase with age. This group of men averages 3 to 4 visits to their primary care doctors annually, providing an opportunity for skin cancer screenings. Other well-established risk factors, such as lighter skin pigmentation, sunburns, indoor tanning bed exposure, personal and family history of melanoma, personal history of nonmelanoma skin cancer, multiple nevi, and evolving nevi, should also warrant more frequent skin examinations.

【149】In 2016, US President Barack Obama launched a national cancer initiative program known as the Cancer Moonshot Task Force. The Moonshot Program, developed at The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center, includes goals for initial screenings and the development of early treatments for some of the deadliest cancers. Patients surveyed in this program ranked melanoma second in importance. Although the USPSTF has not found sufficient evidence to advocate for widespread melanoma screening, we have identified other pathways to improving outcomes for malignant melanoma. Primary prevention through public awareness and education has been found to be a pathway for success. Educating primary care residents and primary care physicians on skin cancer evaluation is recommended for improving early detection. A concerted effort between primary care and dermatology is vital to realize advancements in this difficult public health problem. The challenge we support is an opportunity to change current practices to affect the burden of disease. For malignant melanoma, now is the time for change.

title: Abiraterone, Micronized (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Abiraterone, Micronized (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Yonsa

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Note: Women of childbearing potential should not use or handle abiraterone tablets without protection (eg, gloves).

【6】Abiraterone is used in combination with methylprednisolone to treat patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (prostate cancer that is resistant to medical or surgical treatments that lower testosterone and has already spread to other parts of the body).

【7】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【8】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【9】*   Tablet

【10】Before Using
------------

【11】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【12】### Allergies

【13】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【14】### Pediatric

【15】Abiraterone is not indicated for use in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【16】### Geriatric

【17】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of abiraterone in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more sensitive to the effects of this medicine than younger adults.

【18】### Breastfeeding

【19】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【20】### Drug Interactions

【21】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【22】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【23】*   Daprodustat
*   Dasabuvir
*   Eliglustat
*   Selexipag

【24】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【25】*   Abametapir
*   Amiodarone
*   Amphetamine
*   Apalutamide
*   Benzphetamine
*   Carbamazepine
*   Cilostazol
*   Clozapine
*   Codeine
*   Dabrafenib
*   Dextroamphetamine
*   Dihydrocodeine
*   Domperidone
*   Donepezil
*   Doxorubicin
*   Doxorubicin Hydrochloride Liposome
*   Enzalutamide
*   Fedratinib
*   Fexinidazole
*   Fluoxetine
*   Fosphenytoin
*   Hydroxyamphetamine
*   Ifosfamide
*   Itraconazole
*   Lisdexamfetamine
*   Lumacaftor
*   Lurasidone
*   Methamphetamine
*   Mitotane
*   Naloxegol
*   Olaparib
*   Omaveloxolone
*   Ospemifene
*   Oxycodone
*   Ozanimod
*   Paclitaxel
*   Phenobarbital
*   Phenytoin
*   Pioglitazone
*   Piperaquine
*   Pixantrone
*   Primidone
*   Radium Ra 223 Dichloride
*   Rifampin
*   Rosiglitazone
*   Rosuvastatin
*   Simeprevir
*   St John's Wort
*   Tamoxifen
*   Thioridazine
*   Tucatinib
*   Vortioxetine

【26】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines may cause an increased risk of certain side effects, but using both drugs may be the best treatment for you. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【27】*   Dextromethorphan
*   Repaglinide

【28】### Other Interactions

【29】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【30】### Other Medical Problems

【31】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【32】*   Adrenal or pituitary problems, history of or
*   Heart attack, recent or
*   Heart failure or
*   Heart or blood vessel disease, history of or
*   Heart rhythm problems (eg, ventricular arrhythmia, QT prolongation, torsades de pointes) or
*   Hypertension (high blood pressure) or
*   Hypokalemia (low potassium in the blood)—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【33】*   Liver disease, moderate—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【34】*   Liver disease, severe—Should not be used in patients with this condition.

【35】Proper Use
----------

【36】Take this medicine only as directed by your doctor. Do not take more of it, do not take it more often, and do not take it for a longer time than your doctor ordered.

【37】This medicine comes with a patient information leaflet. Read and follow the instructions carefully. Ask your doctor if you have questions.

【38】Swallow the tablets whole with water. Do not crush or chew the tablets.

【39】You may take this tablet with or without food.

【40】Use only the brand of this medicine that your doctor prescribed. Different brands have different dosages and effects when taken with food.

【41】Your doctor may give you other medicines (eg, gonadotropin-releasing hormone) unless you had a surgery to lower the amount of testosterone in your body.

【42】### Dosing

【43】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【44】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【45】*   For oral dosage form (tablets):
    *   For castration-resistant prostate cancer:
        *   Adults—500 milligrams (mg) (four 125 mg tablets taken as a single dose) once a day, taken together with 4 mg methylprednisolone 2 times a day.
        *   Children—Use is not recommended.

【46】### Missed Dose

【47】If you miss a dose of this medicine, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【48】If you missed a dose of this medicine, take your normal dose the following day. If more than one daily dose is missed, call your doctor.

【49】### Storage

【50】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【51】Keep out of the reach of children.

【52】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【53】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【54】Precautions
-----------

【55】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits to make sure that this medicine is working properly. Blood and urine tests will be needed to check for any unwanted effects that may be caused by this medicine.

【56】Women and children should not use this medicine. Pregnant women or women who may become pregnant should not handle or touch the tablets without protection (eg, gloves). This medicine may also cause birth defects if the father is using it when his sexual partner becomes pregnant. You must use a condom and another effective method of birth control during treatment with this medicine and for at least 3 weeks after the last dose. If a pregnancy occurs while you are using this medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【57】If you plan to have children, talk with your doctor before using this medicine. Some men using this medicine have become infertile (unable to have children).

【58】You will also need to have your blood pressure measured before starting this medicine and while you are using it. If you notice any changes to your recommended blood pressure, call your doctor right away. If you have questions about this, talk to your doctor.

【59】Do not interrupt or stop using this medicine together with methylprednisolone without first asking your doctor. This may increase your risk of having adrenal gland problems. Talk to your doctor if you have darkening of the skin, diarrhea, dizziness, fainting, loss of appetite, mental depression, nausea, skin rash, unusual tiredness or weakness, or vomiting.

【60】Check with your doctor right away if you have pain or tenderness in the upper stomach, pale stools, dark urine, loss of appetite, nausea, unusual tiredness or weakness, or yellow eyes or skin. These could be symptoms of a serious liver problem.

【61】This medicine together with methylprednisolone may increase your risk for fractures when used with a radiation treatment (eg, radium Ra 223 dichloride). Talk with your doctor about this risk.

【62】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【63】Side Effects
------------

【64】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【65】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【66】#### More common

【67】1.  Bladder pain
2.  bloody or cloudy urine
3.  blurred vision
4.  body aches or pain
5.  chills
6.  cough
7.  decreased urine
8.  difficult, burning, or painful urination
9.  dizziness
10.  dry mouth
11.  ear congestion
12.  fainting
13.  fast, slow, or irregular heartbeat
14.  fever
15.  fractures
16.  frequent urge to urinate
17.  headache
18.  increased thirst
19.  loss of appetite
20.  loss of voice
21.  lower back or side pain
22.  mood changes
23.  nausea or vomiting
24.  numbness or tingling in the hands, feet, or lips
25.  nervousness
26.  pounding in the ears
27.  runny or stuffy nose
28.  seizures
29.  slow or fast heartbeat
30.  sneezing
31.  sore throat
32.  swelling
33.  trouble breathing
34.  unusual bleeding or bruising
35.  unusual tiredness or weakness

【68】#### Less common

【69】1.  Chest pain, discomfort, or tightness
2.  dilated neck veins
3.  irregular breathing
4.  weight gain

【70】#### Incidence not known

【71】1.  Clay-colored stools
2.  dark urine
3.  diarrhea
4.  general feeling of discomfort or illness
5.  itching, rash
6.  muscle cramp, spasm, pain, or stiffness
7.  stomach pain, continuing
8.  thickening of bronchial secretions
9.  unpleasant breath odor
10.  vomiting of blood
11.  yellow eyes or skin

【72】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【73】#### More common

【74】1.  Constipation
2.  falls
3.  feeling of warmth
4.  groin pain
5.  increased urge to urinate during the night
6.  joint swelling or discomfort
7.  redness of the face, neck, arms, and occasionally, upper chest
8.  trouble sleeping
9.  waking to urinate at night

【75】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【76】无关删除-1Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

【77】无关删除-1Portions of this document last updated: Aug. 01, 2023

【78】无关删除-1Original article: https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements/abiraterone-micronized-oral-route/description/drg-20443801

title: Anifrolumab-Fnia (Intravenous Route)
text:
【0】Anifrolumab-Fnia (Intravenous Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Saphnelo

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Anifrolumab-fnia injection is used to treat moderate to severe systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in patients who are also receiving other lupus treatments. It is a monoclonal antibody that changes the immune system to help control lupus symptoms.

【6】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【7】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【8】*   Solution

【9】Before Using
------------

【10】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【11】### Allergies

【12】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【13】### Pediatric

【14】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of anifrolumab-fnia injection in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【15】### Geriatric

【16】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of anifrolumab-fnia injection in the elderly.

【17】### Breastfeeding

【18】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【19】### Drug Interactions

【20】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are receiving this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【21】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【22】*   Abatacept
*   Adalimumab

【23】### Other Interactions

【24】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【25】### Other Medical Problems

【26】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【27】*   Cancer, history of—Use with caution. May make this condition worse.

【28】*   Central nervous system lupus, severe active or
*   Lupus nephritis, severe active—Use is not recommended in patients with these conditions.

【29】*   Infection or
*   Weak immune system—May decrease your body's ability to fight infection.

【30】Proper Use
----------

【31】A nurse or other trained health professional will give you this medicine in a medical facility. It is given through a needle placed into one of your veins. It must be given slowly, so the needle will have to remain in place for at least 30 minutes. It is usually given every 4 weeks.

【32】This medicine comes with a patient information leaflet. Read and follow these instructions carefully. Ask your doctor if you have any questions.

【33】### Missed Dose

【34】无关删除-1Call your doctor or pharmacist for instructions.

【35】无关删除-1Precautions
-----------

【36】无关删除-1It is very important that your doctor check your progress closely and at regular visits to make sure this medicine is working properly and to decide if you should continue to receive it. Blood tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【37】无关删除-1Tell your doctor if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant during treatment with this medicine.

【38】无关删除-1Do not have any live vaccines (immunizations) while you are being treated with anifrolumab-fnia. Check with your doctor before having any vaccines.

【41】无关删除-1This medicine may cause serious allergic reactions, including anaphylaxis and angioedema, which can be life-threatening and requires immediate medical attention. 【44】无关删除-1Side Effects
------------

【45】无关删除-1Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

8.  tender, swollen glands in the neck

【54】无关删除-1Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

title: Adapalene And Benzoyl Peroxide (Topical Application Route)
text:
【0】Adapalene And Benzoyl Peroxide (Topical Application Route)
Precautions
-----------

【1】It is important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits. This will allow your doctor to see if the medicine is working properly and to decide if you should continue to use it.

【2】This medicine may make your skin more sensitive to sunlight, wind, and cold weather. Use a sunscreen when you are outdoors. Avoid sunlamps and tanning beds. You may need to wear protective clothing, such as a hat.

【3】Skin reactions such as dryness, redness, scaling, burning, or stinging can occur when you use this medicine. Use a moisturizer as needed to lessen these skin problems.

【4】Do not use any other medicines on the treated skin areas without asking your doctor. Avoid using any skin care products that can dry or irritate your skin. These include rough skin cleansers, hair removal products, soaps or cosmetics that cause dryness, or products that contain alcohol, astringents, spices, or lime.

【5】Do not use "waxing" as a hair removal method on skin areas treated with this medicine.

【6】Allow this medicine to dry completely before getting dressed. This medicine may cause bleaching of clothes or hair. I

【7】Side Effects
------------

【8】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【9】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【10】#### More common

【11】1.  Dryness and peeling of the skin
2.  flushing or redness of the skin
3.  unusually warm skin

【12】#### Less common

【13】1.  Blistering, burning, crusting, or flaking of the skin
2.  burning, itching, redness, skin rash, swelling, or soreness at the application site
3.  scaling, severe redness, or swelling of the skin

【14】#### Incidence not known

【15】1.  Skin pain
2.  sunburn

【16】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【17】#### Incidence not known

【18】1.  Burning, dry, or itching eyes
2.  change in the color of the treated skin
3.  discharge or excessive tearing
4.  redness, pain, or swelling of the eye, eyelid, or inner lining of the eyelid
5.  skin rash, encrusted, scaly, and oozing
6.  swelling of the face

【19】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【20】无关删除-1Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

title: Risk of Venous Thromboembolism in Men Receiving Testosterone Therapy
text:
【0】Risk of Venous Thromboembolism in Men Receiving Testosterone Therapy
Abstract
--------

【1】### Objective

【2】To examine the risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) associated with exposure to testosterone therapy in middle-aged and older men.

【3】### Patients and Methods

【4】We conducted a case-control study of 30,572 men 40 years and older who were enrolled in one of the nation’s largest commercial insurance programs between January 1, 2007, and December 31, 2012. _Cases_ were defined as men who had a primary diagnosis of VTE and received an anticoagulant drug in the 60 days after their diagnoses. Cases were matched with 3 controls on event/index month, age, geographic region, diagnosis of hypogonadism, and diagnosis of any underlying prothrombotic condition. Conditional logistic regression analysis was used to calculate adjusted odds ratios (aORs) and 95% CIs for the risk of VTE associated with previous exposure to testosterone therapy.

【5】### Results

【6】Exposure to testosterone therapy in the 15 days before the event/index date was not associated with an increased risk of VTE (aOR, 0.90; 95% CI, 0.73-1.12). None of the specific routes of administration examined were associated with an increased risk of VTE (topical \[aOR, 0.80; 95% CI, 0.61-10.41\], transdermal \[aOR, 0.91; 95% CI, 0.38-2.16\], and intramuscular \[aOR, 1.15; 95% CI, 0.80-1.64\]). These findings persisted using exposure windows that extended to 30 and 60 days before the event/index date.

【7】### Conclusion

【8】Having filled a prescription for testosterone therapy was not associated with an increased risk of VTE in commercially insured middle-aged and older men. These findings may provide clinically relevant information about the benefit-risk assessment for men with testosterone deficiency considering treatment.

【9】#### Abbreviations and Acronyms:

【10】aOR ( adjusted odds ratio ), CDM ( Clinformatics Data Mart ), DVT ( deep vein thrombosis ), FDA ( Food and Drug Administration ), ICD-9-CM ( International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification ), NSAID ( nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ), PE ( pulmonary embolism ), VTE ( venous thromboembolism )

title: Butabarbital (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Butabarbital (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Butisol Sodium

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Butabarbital is used to treat insomnia (trouble sleeping). It is also used before a surgical procedure to make a person sleep (be unconscious).

【6】Butabarbital belongs to the group of medicines called barbiturates. They act in the central nervous system (CNS) to slow down the nervous system. When used to treat insomnia, butabarbital will help you get to sleep faster and sleep throughout the night. In most cases, sleep medicines should only be used for short periods of time, such as 1 or 2 days, and for no longer than 1 or 2 weeks.

【7】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【8】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【9】*   Tablet

【10】Before Using
------------

【11】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【12】### Allergies

【13】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【14】### Pediatric

【15】Appropriate studies to date have not demonstrated pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of butabarbital in children when used before a surgical procedure. However, safety and efficacy have not been established in children to treat insomnia.

【16】### Geriatric

【17】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of butabarbital in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more sensitive to the effects of this medicine and are more likely to have age-related liver or kidney problems, which may require caution and an adjustment in the dose for patients receiving this medicine.

【18】### Breastfeeding

【19】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【20】### Drug Interactions

【21】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【22】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【23】*   Alprazolam
*   Amobarbital
*   Anisindione
*   Aprobarbital
*   Barbital
*   Benzhydrocodone
*   Bromazepam
*   Bromopride
*   Buprenorphine
*   Butalbital
*   Butorphanol
*   Calcium Oxybate
*   Cannabidiol
*   Cannabis
*   Carbinoxamine
*   Carisoprodol
*   Cetirizine
*   Chloral Hydrate
*   Chlordiazepoxide
*   Chlorzoxazone
*   Clarithromycin
*   Clonazepam
*   Clorazepate
*   Codeine
*   Dantrolene
*   Daridorexant
*   Darunavir
*   Dexmedetomidine
*   Diazepam
*   Dicumarol
*   Dihydrocodeine
*   Doxorubicin
*   Doxorubicin Hydrochloride Liposome
*   Doxylamine
*   Estazolam
*   Eterobarb
*   Ethchlorvynol
*   Ethinyl Estradiol
*   Etonogestrel
*   Fentanyl
*   Flibanserin
*   Flunitrazepam
*   Flurazepam
*   Fospropofol
*   Gabapentin
*   Gabapentin Enacarbil
*   Halazepam
*   Heptabarbital
*   Hexobarbital
*   Hydrocodone
*   Hydromorphone
*   Ketamine
*   Ketazolam
*   Lacosamide
*   Lemborexant
*   Levocetirizine
*   Levorphanol
*   Lofexidine
*   Lorazepam
*   Lormetazepam
*   Loxapine
*   Magnesium Oxybate
*   Meclizine
*   Medazepam
*   Meperidine
*   Mephenesin
*   Mephobarbital
*   Meprobamate
*   Metaxalone
*   Methadone
*   Methocarbamol
*   Methohexital
*   Metoclopramide
*   Midazolam
*   Morphine
*   Morphine Sulfate Liposome
*   Nalbuphine
*   Nifedipine
*   Nitrazepam
*   Norethindrone
*   Norgestrel
*   Oxazepam
*   Oxycodone
*   Oxymorphone
*   Pentazocine
*   Pentobarbital
*   Periciazine
*   Phenindione
*   Phenobarbital
*   Phenprocoumon
*   Piperaquine
*   Potassium Oxybate
*   Prazepam
*   Pregabalin
*   Primidone
*   Procarbazine
*   Propofol
*   Quazepam
*   Remifentanil
*   Remimazolam
*   Ropeginterferon Alfa-2b-njft
*   Scopolamine
*   Secobarbital
*   Sodium Oxybate
*   Sufentanil

*   Temazepam
*   Thiopental

*   Triazolam
*   Ulipristal
*   Zolpidem

【24】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines may cause an increased risk of certain side effects, but using both drugs may be the best treatment for you. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【25】*   Ospemifene
*   Prednisone
*   St John's Wort
*   Warfarin

【26】### Other Interactions

【27】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【28】Using this medicine with any of the following may cause an increased risk of certain side effects but may be unavoidable in some cases. If used together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use this medicine, or give you special instructions about the use of food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【29】*   Ethanol

【30】### Other Medical Problems

【31】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【32】*   Alcohol abuse, history of or
*   Asthma or
*   Depression or
*   Drug abuse, history of or
*   Mental illness, history of or
*   Patients with suicidal thoughts or behavior—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【33】*   Kidney disease or
*   Liver disease—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【34】*   Liver disease, severe (eg, hepatic coma) or
*   Porphyria (enzyme problem), manifest or latent, history of—Should not be used in patients with these conditions.

【35】*   Patients with acute or chronic pain (except pain after surgery or chemotherapy)—Use with caution. May cause an opposite effect to one which is normally expected and mask symptoms of other unknown diseases.

【36】Proper Use
----------

【37】Take this medicine only as directed by your doctor. Do not take more of it, do not take it more often, and do not take it for a longer time than your doctor ordered. If too much is taken, it may become habit-forming (causing mental or physical dependence).

【38】If you are using butabarbital to treat insomnia:

【39】*   Take it just before going to bed, when you are ready to go to sleep. This medicine works very quickly to put you to sleep.
*   Do not take this medicine when your schedule does not permit you to get a full night's sleep (about 7 to 8 hours). If you must wake up before this, you may continue to feel drowsy and may experience memory problems, because the effects of the medicine have not had time to wear off.

【40】Take this medicine on an empty stomach.

【41】Shake the oral liquid well before each use. Measure the medicine with a marked measuring spoon, oral syringe, or medicine cup. The average household teaspoon may not hold the right amount of liquid.

【42】### Dosing

【43】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【44】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【45】*   For oral dosage forms (solution, tablets):
    *   For daytime sleepiness:
        *   Adults—15 to 30 milligrams (mg) 3 or 4 times a day.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.
    *   For insomnia:
        *   Adults—50 to 100 milligrams (mg).
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.
    *   For sleepiness before surgery:
        *   Adults—50 to 100 milligrams (mg), 60 to 90 minutes before surgery.
        *   Children—Dose is based on body weight and must be determined by your doctor. The dose is usually 2 to 6 mg per kilogram (kg) of body weight per day. However, the dose is not more than 100 mg per day.

【46】### Missed Dose

【47】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【48】If you use this medicine to treat insomnia, take it only when you cannot sleep. You do not need to keep a schedule for taking it.

【49】### Storage

【50】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【51】Keep out of the reach of children.

【52】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【53】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【54】Precautions
-----------

【55】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits to make sure this medicine is working properly. Blood and urine tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【56】Using this medicine while you are pregnant can harm your unborn baby. Birth control pills may not work as well to prevent pregnancy when used with this medicine. Use another form of birth control (eg, condoms, spermicide) along with your pills. If you think you have become pregnant while using this medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【57】If you think you need to take butabarbital for more than 7 to 10 days, be sure to discuss it with your doctor. Insomnia that lasts longer than this may be a sign of another medical problem.

【58】Butabarbital may cause serious allergic reactions, including anaphylaxis and angioedema, which can be life-threatening and require immediate medical attention. Call your doctor right away if you have a rash, itching, hives, trouble breathing or swallowing, or any swelling of your hands, face, mouth, or throat while you are using this medicine.

【59】This medicine contains a yellow dye called tartrazine, which may cause severe allergic reactions. Tell your doctor if you have any allergies, including an allergy to aspirin, or asthma.

【60】This medicine will add to the effects of alcohol and other CNS depressants (medicines that make you drowsy or less alert). Some examples of CNS depressants are antihistamines or medicine for hay fever, other allergies, or colds, sedatives, tranquilizers, or sleeping medicine, prescription pain medicine or narcotics, medicine for seizures or barbiturates, muscle relaxants, or anesthetics, including some dental anesthetics. Check with your doctor before taking any of the above while you are using this medicine.

【61】This medicine may cause some people, especially older persons, to become drowsy, dizzy, lightheaded, clumsy or unsteady, or less alert than they are normally, which may lead to falls. Even though butabarbital is taken at bedtime, it may cause some people to feel drowsy or less alert on arising. Do not drive or do anything else that could be dangerous until you know how this medicine affects you.

【62】If you develop any unusual and strange thoughts or behavior while you are using butabarbital, be sure to discuss it with your doctor. Some changes that have occurred in people using this medicine are like those seen in people who drink alcohol and then act in a manner that is not normal. Other changes may be more unusual and extreme, such as confusion, worsening of depression, hallucinations (seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there), suicidal thoughts, and unusual excitement, nervousness, or irritability.

【63】This medicine may cause you to do things while you are still asleep that you may not remember the next morning. It is possible you could drive a car, sleepwalk, have sex, make phone calls, or prepare and eat food while you are asleep or not fully awake. Tell your doctor right away if you learn that any of these has happened.

【64】Do not change your dose or stop using it without first checking with your doctor. Your doctor may want you to gradually reduce the amount you are using before stopping completely. Stopping this medicine suddenly may cause withdrawal side effects.

【65】If you think you or someone else may have taken an overdose of this medicine, get emergency help at once. Taking an overdose of butabarbital or taking alcohol or other CNS depressants with butabarbital may lead to serious breathing problems and unconsciousness. Some signs of an overdose include: severe drowsiness, severe nausea or vomiting, staggering, and troubled breathing.

【66】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【67】Side Effects
------------

【68】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【69】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【70】#### Rare

【71】1.  Agitation
2.  bluish lips or skin
3.  blurred vision
4.  chest pain or discomfort
5.  confusion
6.  dark urine
7.  discouragement
8.  dizziness, faintness, or lightheadedness when getting up suddenly from a lying or sitting position
9.  extremely shallow or slow breathing
10.  false beliefs that cannot be changed by facts
11.  fast heartbeat
12.  feeling sad or empty
13.  fever
14.  hives, itching, skin rash
15.  hoarseness
16.  increase in body movements
17.  irritability
18.  joint pain, stiffness, or swelling
19.  lack of appetite
20.  large, hive-like swelling on face, eyelids, lips, tongue, throat, hands, legs, feet, or genitals
21.  light-colored stools
22.  lightheadedness, dizziness, or fainting
23.  loss of interest or pleasure
24.  mood or other mental changes
25.  nausea
26.  not breathing
27.  poor insight and judgment
28.  problems with memory or speech
29.  redness of the skin
30.  seeing, hearing, or feeling things that are not there
31.  shakiness and unsteady walk
32.  slow or irregular heartbeat
33.  stomach pain or bloating
34.  sweating
35.  swelling of the eyelids, face, lips, hands, or feet
36.  tightness in the chest
37.  trouble concentrating
38.  trouble recognizing objects
39.  trouble sleeping
40.  trouble thinking and planning
41.  trouble walking
42.  troubled breathing or swallowing
43.  unsteadiness, trembling, or other problems with muscle control or coordination
44.  unusual tiredness or weakness
45.  vomiting
46.  yellow eyes or skin

【72】Get emergency help immediately if any of the following symptoms of overdose occur:

【73】#### Symptoms of overdose

【74】1.  Blurred vision
2.  chills
3.  cold, clammy skin
4.  confusion
5.  cool hands and feet
6.  decrease in the amount of urine
7.  difficult or troubled breathing
8.  dizziness, faintness, or lightheadedness when getting up suddenly from a lying or sitting position
9.  fast, pounding, or irregular heartbeat or pulse
10.  irregular, fast or slow, or shallow breathing
11.  irritability
12.  loss of consciousness
13.  pale or blue lips, fingernails, or skin
14.  poor judgment
15.  shivering
16.  slurred speech
17.  sweating
18.  trouble in walking
19.  trouble sleeping
20.  uncontrolled eye movements

【75】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【76】#### Less common

【77】1.  Sleepiness or unusual drowsiness

【78】#### Rare

【79】1.  Constipation
2.  headache
3.  nervousness
4.  nightmares

【80】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【81】无关删除-1Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

title: Asciminib (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Asciminib (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Scemblix

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Asciminib is used to treat Philadelphia chromosome positive chronic myeloid leukemia (Ph+ CML) in chronic phase (CP) who have taken 2 or more medicines, including tyrosine-kinase inhibitors (TKIs). It is also used to treat Ph+ CML in CP with the T315I mutation. Leukemia is a type of cancer where the body makes too many abnormal white blood cells.

【6】Asciminib belongs to the general group of medicines known as antineoplastics or cancer medicines. It interferes with the growth of cancer cells, which are eventually destroyed by the body.

【7】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【8】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【9】*   Tablet

【10】Before Using
------------

【11】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【12】### Allergies

【13】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【14】### Pediatric

【15】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of asciminib in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【16】### Geriatric

【17】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of asciminib in the elderly.

【18】### Breastfeeding

【19】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【20】### Drug Interactions

【21】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【22】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【23】*   Alfentanil
*   Celecoxib
*   Cyclosporine
*   Dihydroergotamine
*   Dofetilide
*   Ergotamine
*   Fentanyl
*   Flibanserin
*   Fosphenytoin
*   Itraconazole
*   Oxycodone
*   Phenytoin
*   Pimavanserin
*   Pimozide
*   Quinidine
*   Sirolimus
*   Tacrolimus
*   Temsirolimus
*   Warfarin

【24】### Other Interactions

【25】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【26】### Other Medical Problems

【27】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【28】*   Heart or blood vessel disease, history of or
*   Heart rhythm problems (eg, arrhythmia, QT prolongation) or
*   Hypertension (high blood pressure) or
*   Pancreatitis (swelling of the pancreas), history of—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【29】Proper Use
----------

【30】Take this medicine exactly as directed by your doctor. Do not take more of it, do not take it more often, and do not take it for a longer time than your doctor ordered. Do not change the dose or stop using this medicine without checking first with your doctor.

【31】Medicines used to treat cancer are very strong and can have many side effects. Before receiving this medicine, make sure you understand all of the risks and benefits. It is important for you to work closely with your doctor during your treatment.

【32】This medicine should come with a patient information leaflet. Read and follow these instructions carefully. Ask your doctor or pharmacist if you have any questions.

【33】Take this medicine on an empty stomach. Do not eat for at least 2 hours before or 1 hour after you take this medicine.

【34】Swallow the tablet whole. Do not break, cut, crush, or chew it.

【35】### Dosing

【36】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【37】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【38】*   For oral dosage form (tablets):
    *   For the treatment of Ph+ CML in CP in patients who have taken 2 or more TKIs:
        *   Adults—80 milligrams (mg) once a day or 40 mg 2 times a day at least 12 hours apart. Your doctor may adjust your dose as needed and tolerated.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.
    *   For the treatment of Ph+ CML in CP with the T315I mutation:
        *   Adults—200 milligrams (mg) 2 times a day at least 12 hours apart. Your doctor may adjust your dose as needed and tolerated.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【39】### Missed Dose

【40】If you miss a dose of this medicine, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【41】Once a day regimen: If you miss a dose and it is more than 12 hours of your scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule.

【42】Twice a day regimen: If you miss a dose and it is more than 6 hours of your scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule.

【43】### Storage

【44】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【45】Keep out of the reach of children.

【46】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【47】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【48】Precautions
-----------

【49】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits to make sure that this medicine is working properly. Blood tests will be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【50】Using this medicine while you are pregnant can harm your unborn baby. If you are a woman who can get pregnant, your doctor may do tests to make sure you are not pregnant before starting this medicine. Use an effective form of birth control during treatment with this medicine and for at least 1 week after the last dose to keep from getting pregnant. If you think you have become pregnant while using the medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【51】Some women who use this medicine have become infertile (unable to have children). Talk with your doctor before using this medicine if you plan to have children.

【52】Pancreatitis (swelling of the pancreas) may occur while you are using this medicine. Check with your doctor right away if you have bloating, chills, constipation, dark urine, fast heartbeat, fever, loss of appetite, nausea, pains in the stomach, side, or abdomen, possibly radiating to the back, upset stomach, vomiting, or yellow eyes or skin.

【53】Check with your doctor right away if you have chest discomfort or pain, dizziness, decreased urine output, fast, irregular, or pounding heartbeat, numbness or weakness on one side of the body, pain in the arms, legs, back, neck, or jaw, problems with vision, speech, or walking, rapid weight gain, swelling of the feet or lower legs, sudden or severe headache, trouble breathing, or unusual tiredness or weakness. These could be symptoms of a serious heart or blood vessel problem (eg, blood clots, heart attack, heart failure, stroke).

【54】This medicine may cause hypertension (high blood pressure). Check with your doctor right away if you have blurred vision, dizziness, headache, nervousness, pounding in the ears, or slow or fast heartbeat.

【55】This medicine lowers the number of some types of blood cells in your body. Because of this, you may bleed or get infections more easily. To help with these problems, avoid being near people who are sick or have infections. Wash your hands often. Stay away from rough sports or other situations where you could be bruised, cut, or injured. Brush and floss your teeth gently. Be careful when using sharp objects, including razors and fingernail clippers.

【56】This medicine may cause serious allergic reactions. Check with your doctor right away if you have chest tightness, cough, dizziness, fainting, fast heartbeat, fever, skin rash or redness, swelling of the face, lips, or tongue, or trouble breathing or swallowing.

【57】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【58】Side Effects
------------

【59】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【60】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【61】#### More common

【62】1.  Black, tarry stools
2.  bleeding gums
3.  blood in the urine or stools
4.  blurred vision
5.  body aches or pain
6.  chest pain or tightness
7.  chills
8.  cough
9.  decreased urine output
10.  dilated neck veins
11.  dizziness
12.  ear congestion
13.  difficulty in breathing
14.  fainting
15.  fever
16.  headache
17.  hives, itching, skin rash
18.  hoarseness
19.  irregular heartbeat
20.  irritation
21.  joint pain, stiffness, or swelling
22.  loss of voice
23.  lower back or side pain
24.  nervousness
25.  painful or difficult urination
26.  pale skin
27.  pinpoint red spots on the skin
28.  pounding in the ears
29.  redness of the skin
30.  slow or fast heartbeat
31.  sneezing
32.  sore throat
33.  stuffy or runny nose
34.  swelling of the eyelids, face, lips, hands, or feet
35.  trouble swallowing
36.  ulcers, sores, or white spots in the mouth
37.  unusual bleeding or bruising
38.  unusual tiredness or weakness
39.  weight gain

【63】#### Less common

【64】1.  Bladder pain
2.  bloating
3.  bloody or cloudy urine
4.  burning urination
5.  coughing up blood
6.  frequent urge to urinate
7.  increased menstrual flow or vaginal bleeding
8.  indigestion
9.  nosebleeds
10.  pains in the chest, groin, or legs, especially calves of the legs
11.  pains in the stomach, side, or abdomen, possibly radiating to the back
12.  paralysis
13.  prolonged bleeding from cuts
14.  severe headaches of sudden onset
15.  sudden loss of coordination
16.  sudden onset of slurred speech
17.  sudden vision changes
18.  vomiting
19.  yellow eyes or skin

【65】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【66】#### More common

【67】1.  Diarrhea
2.  difficulty in moving
3.  muscle or bone pain
4.  muscle stiffness
5.  pain in the joints
6.  stomach pain

【68】#### Less common

【69】1.  Constipation

【70】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【71】无关删除-1Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

title: A Multicenter Study of Burnout, Depression, and Quality of Life in Minority and Nonminority US Medical Students
text:
【0】A Multicenter Study of Burnout, Depression, and Quality of Life in Minority and Nonminority US Medical Students
### OBJECTIVE

【1】To determine the well-being of minority medical students in a multicenter sample of US medical students.

【2】### PARTICIPANTS AND METHODS

【3】All 1098 medical students at 3 medical schools in Minnesota were surveyed in April 2004. Validated instruments were used to assess burnout, depression, and quality of life (QOL). Students were also asked about the prevalence of significant personal life events in the previous 12 months and strategies used to cope with stress.

【4】### RESULTS

【5】Although symptoms of depression and overall burnout were similar among minority and nonminority students, minority students were more likely to have a low sense of personal accomplishment ( _P_ \=.02) and lower QOL in a number of domains (all _P_ ≤.05). These differences persisted on multivariate analysis that controlled for demographic characteristics and recent life events. Minority students were also more likely to have a child ( _P_ \=.01), originate from outside Minnesota ( _P_ <.001), and experience a major personal illness in the last 12 months ( _P_ \=.03).

【6】### CONCLUSION

【7】As a group, the minority medical students in this survey had a lower sense of personal accomplishment and QOL than nonminority students. Additional studies are needed to provide insight regarding the causes of these inequities and the unique challenges faced by minority medical students. Efforts to improve minority students' well-being, QOL, and learning experience may help prevent attrition among minority medical students and promote diversification in the physician workforce.

【8】LASA ( Linear Analogue Self Assessment Well-being Survey ), QOL ( quality of life ), SF-8 ( Medical Outcomes Study 8-Item Short-Form Health Survey ), URM ( underrepresented minority )

title: Clinical and Economic Burden of Hospitalizations for Infective Endocarditis in the United States
text:
【0】Clinical and Economic Burden of Hospitalizations for Infective Endocarditis in the United States
Abstract
--------

【1】### Objective

【2】To assess contemporary trends in the incidence, characteristics, and outcomes of hospital admissions for infective endocarditis (IE) in the United States.

【3】### Patients and Methods

【4】Patients ≥18 years admitted with IE between January 1, 2003, and December 31, 2016, were identified in the National Inpatient Sample. We assessed the annual incidence, clinical characteristics, morbidity, mortality, and cost of IE-related hospitalizations.

【5】### Results

【6】The incidence of IE-related hospitalizations increased from 34,488 (15.9; 95% confidence interval \[CI\], 15.73, 16.06) per 100,000 adults) in 2003 to 54,405 (21.8; 95% CI, 21.60-21.97) per 100,000 adults) in 2016 ( _P_ <.001). The prevalence of patients below 30 years of age, and those who inject drugs, increased from 7.3% to 14.5% and from 4.8% to 15.1%, respectively ( _P_ <.001). The annual volume of valve surgery for IE increased from 4049 in 2003 to 6460 in 2016 ( _P_ <.001), but the ratio of valve surgery to IE-hospitalizations did not decrease (11.7% in 2003; 11.8% in 2016). There was also a temporal increase in risk-adjusted rates of stroke (8.0% to 13.2%), septic shock (5.4% to 16.3%), and mechanical ventilation (7.7% to 16.5%; _P_ <.001). However, risk-adjusted mortality decreased from 14.4% to 9.8% ( _P_ <.001). Median length-of-stay and mean inflation-adjusted cost decreased from 11 to 10 days and from $45,810±$61,787 to $43,020±$55,244, respectively, ( _P_ <.001). Nonetheless, the expenditure on IE hospitalizations increased ($1.58 billion in 2003 to $2.34 billion in 2016; _P_ <.001).

【7】### Conclusions

【8】There is a substantial recent rise in endocarditis hospitalizations in the United States. Although the adjusted in-hospital mortality of endocarditis and the cost of admission decreased over time, the overall expenditure on in-hospital care for endocarditis increased.

【9】#### Abbreviations and Acronyms:

【10】IE ( infective endocarditis ), IVDU ( intravenous drug use ), NIS ( National Inpatient Sample ), OR ( odds ratio )

title: High Prevalence of Celiac Disease Among Screened First-Degree Relatives
text:
【0】High Prevalence of Celiac Disease Among Screened First-Degree Relatives
Abstract
--------

【1】### Objective

【2】To investigate the prevalence of first-degree relatives (FDRs) with celiac disease detected at screening and diagnostic significance of anti-tissue transglutaminase (anti-TTG).

【3】### Patients and Methods

【4】We performed a retrospective cohort study of 104 patients with a diagnosis of celiac disease and their FDRs, collecting data from electronic records of Mayo Clinic and celiac disease registry from December 20, 1983, to May 22, 2017. We collected demographics, presenting symptoms, indication for testing, family history, number of other family members screened, biopsy reports, and results of serologic tests.

【5】### Results

【6】Of 477 FDRs identified, 360 were screened (mean screening rate per family, 79%±25%) and 160 FDRs (44.4%) were diagnosed with celiac disease, at a mean age 31.9±21.6 years (62% female). All diagnosed FDRs had positive anti-TTG titers. Clinical features were documented in 148 diagnosed FDRs, of those 9 (6%) had classic, 97 (66%) had non-classic symptoms, and 42(28%) had no reported symptoms. Histology reports were available from 155 FDRs: 12 (8%) had Marsh 1, 77 (50%) had Marsh 3a, and 66 (43%) had Marsh 3b. A level of anti-TTG greater than or equal to 2.75 of the upper limit of normal identified FDRs with villous atrophy with 87% sensitivity, 82% specificity, and a positive predictive value of 95%.

【7】### Conclusion

【8】In a retrospective cohort study of patients diagnosed with celiac disease, we found a high prevalence of celiac disease among screened FDRs. High anti-TTG titers associated with villous atrophy on small bowel biopsies, irrespective of symptoms.

【9】#### Abbreviations and Acronyms:

【10】anti-TTG ( anti–tissue transglutaminase ), CD ( celiac disease ), EMA ( endomysial antibodies immunoglobulin A ), ESPGHAN ( European Society for Pediatric Gastroenterology, Hepatology and Nutrition ), FDR ( first-degree relative ), ICP ( index case patient ), IEL ( intraepithelial lymphocyte ), Ig ( immunoglobulin ), IQR ( interquartile range ), ROC ( receiver operating characteristic ), SBB ( small bowel biopsy ), ULN ( upper limit of normal ), VA ( villous atrophy )

title: Methylnaltrexone Bromide (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Methylnaltrexone Bromide (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Relistor

【4】### Descriptions

【5】Methylnaltrexone bromide is used to treat constipation caused by opioids (narcotic pain medicines), in adults with long-lasting pain that is not caused by cancer, or in patients with long-lasting pain caused by a previous cancer or its treatment who do not need weekly increases in opioid dosage.

【6】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【7】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【8】*   Tablet

【9】Before Using
------------

【10】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【11】### Allergies

【12】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【13】### Pediatric

【14】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of methylnaltrexone in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【15】### Geriatric

【16】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of methylnaltrexone in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more likely to have diarrhea, which may require caution in the dose for patients receiving this medicine.

【17】### Breastfeeding

【18】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【19】### Drug Interactions

【20】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【21】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【22】*   Morphine
*   Morphine Sulfate Liposome
*   Naldemedine
*   Naloxegol
*   Oxycodone
*   Oxymorphone

【23】### Other Interactions

【24】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【25】### Other Medical Problems

【26】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【27】*   Crohn's disease or
*   Diverticulitis or
*   Ogilvie's syndrome (decreased movement of food in the intestines) or
*   Peptic ulcer or
*   Stomach or bowel cancer—May increase risk for more serious side effects.

【28】*   Liver disease or
*   Kidney disease, severe—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【29】*   Stomach or bowel blockage, known, suspected, or increased risk of—Should not be used in patients with these conditions.

【30】Proper Use
----------

【31】Take this medicine exactly as directed by your doctor. Do not take more of it, do not take it more often, and do not take it for a longer time than your doctor ordered. To do so may increase the chance of side effects.

【32】This medicine comes with a Medication Guide. Read and follow these instructions carefully. Ask your doctor if you have any questions.

【33】Take this medicine with water on an empty stomach at least 30 minutes before the first meal of the day.

【34】Stop taking other laxatives before starting treatment with methylnaltrexone. You should also stop using this medicine if you have stopped taking narcotic pain medicines.

【35】### Dosing

【36】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【37】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【38】*   For oral dosage form (tablets):
    *   For constipation caused by opioids in patients with chronic non-cancer pain:
        *   Adults—450 milligrams (mg) once a day in the morning for at least 4 weeks (with narcotic pain medicines).
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【39】### Missed Dose

【40】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【41】### Storage

【42】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【43】Keep out of the reach of children.

【44】Keep out of the reach of children.

【45】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【46】Precautions
-----------

【47】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits. This will allow your doctor to see if the medicine is working properly and to decide if you should continue to use it.

【48】This medicine may cause a tear (perforation) in your stomach or bowels. Check with your doctor right away if you have a severe stomach pain that does not go away.

【49】If severe or persistent (non-stop) diarrhea occurs while using this medicine, check with your doctor right away.

【50】Do not suddenly stop using this medicine without checking first with your doctor. Doing so may cause withdrawal symptoms, such as anxiety, chills, increased tearing, redness on the face, neck, arms, and upper chest, feeling cold, diarrhea, irritability, stomach pain, increased sweating, and yawning.

【51】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【52】Side Effects
------------

【53】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【54】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【55】#### Incidence not known

【56】1.  Chills
2.  diarrhea
3.  fear or nervousness
4.  increased sweating
5.  severe abdominal or stomach pain
6.  severe or persistent diarrhea
7.  yawning

【57】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【58】#### Less common

【59】1.  Full or bloated feeling
2.  headache
3.  muscle spasms
4.  pressure in the stomach
5.  runny nose
6.  swelling of the abdominal or stomach area
7.  vomiting

【60】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【61】无关删除-1Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.
